actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 712.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 712 â€” "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4365) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1130) to repeal restrictions on the export and import of natural gas; and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 684) condemning the actions of Governor of New Mexico, Michelle Lujan Grisham, for subverting the Second Amendment to the Constitution and depriving the citizens of New Mexico of their right to bear arms."
The House proceeded with one-minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to five per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Boyle of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Bishop Michael E. Dantley, Christ Emmanuel Christian Fellowship, Cincinnati, OH
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
